meanings.definition: Those who use flattery or coaxing to persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The blandishers at the party complimented everyone to get what they wanted.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the blandishers' sweet words and knew their true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The blandishers tried to convince the cat to take its medicine by praising its shiny fur.
meanings.sent4: The blandishers' words were like sugary treats, tempting but not entirely trustworthy.
meanings.sent5: The blandishers' flattery was as transparent as a glass window.

meanings.definition: The act of using flattery or coaxing to persuade someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her success was due to her skillful blandishers and not her own merit.
meanings.sent2: The blandishers of the salesman were so smooth that no one could resist his pitch.
meanings.sent3: The blandishers of the children were so exaggerated that even the dog rolled its eyes.
meanings.sent4: The blandishers of the politician were like a well-rehearsed play, aiming to win over the audience.
meanings.sent5: The blandishers of the chef's cooking were so persuasive that even the pickiest eater couldn't resist.
